intro: Mahawoa montana, commonly known as the mountain mahawoa, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Mahawoa montana is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
